intro: Pilosella rawaruskana, commonly known as the Rawaruskana hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. The yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
